column4: do you have a stock sources.list, or is yours customized somehow?
original with additions - please review at : http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/23181
your sources.list is a bit messed up, that could be why you're getting those errors - rebuild it and try again
have gone back to original and added only 2 - 1 for mplayer and 1 other at the end - http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/23183
I still get the darn libclamav1 held back!
you probably need to get that Debian repo out of there. Debian & Ubuntu are not compatible
not at the binary repo level, anyway
only one you'll need to add to that is the dapper commercial repo - let Add/Remove Apps do that
thank you for you time - again - I am using it and will post result so you can sleep at night
not a problem, hope things work out from now on - just be careful what you stick in sources.list - it's far too easy to screw up your Ubuntu that way
apt-get now says 0.82 installed - but I can find no reverence to it - nor can I start it ip <ugh>
is this clamav still? I know zip about it, actually. I don't bother running any AV on Ubuntu myself.
Yup and I am about to give up for a while
I had a lot of trouble getting spamassassin to work on ubuntu - I am a little dissapointed - there are a few things that still need to be tidied up - when is the new version due - do you know?
no idea, I use gmail for my main email and they have excellent spam filters
that works for you - but I have to support linux here - and I am having some trouble replicating the production box
fair enough - I'm purely a desktop/home user, not a server guy
